answers.answer: Blackening of any limb requires immediate urgent medical attention.Blackening of a limb could be due to gangrene or frost bite and if not treated could mean loss of a limb and in the case of gangrene, the infection spreading.Numbness could be due to damaged nerves either from the operation when this was performed on the leg, from trapped nerves or damage to nerves due to another condition like diabetes.Fainting, vomiting and dizziness, and with a black leg sounds like there is an infection.Get medical urgent attention straight away.

question: Symptoms include: numbness in right leg, fainting, vomiting, dizziness, blackening of leg(this person has had shin splints and fractured legs before)Doctors have previously thought that she might have compartment syndrome however this is a tentative diagnosis
title: Undiagnosed symptoms any idea what this could be?
